When you do rapid stepping (hold down the step key), and have an object 
selected displaying details, we get exceptions in the log. This is because the 
toString attempts an evaluation while a step is in progress. We have to allow 
stepping during evaluations (to be able to hit a breakpoint during an 
evaluation), so this is a tricky timing issue.

*** Bug 14095 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

We would like to disallow stepping while an evaluation is in progress. However, 
if that were a global assumption, we would not be able to stop at a breakpoint 
during an evaluation and step. 

There are (at least) two solutions:
(1) IJavaThread throws an excpetion when unable to perform an evaluation. It 
could provide a status code indicating why. The model presentation can decide 
whether it needs to log an error, and include a note in the "details" 
explaining that the 'toString' is currently unavailable.
(2) evaluations in general can specify a stepping policy - i.e. should stepping 
be allowed during this evaluation? Once the evaluation has begun, step actions 
would be ignored until the eval is complete. The model presentation would 
specify to disallow stepping.

If an implicit eval goes into an infinite loop, you still need to be able to 
pause and step. So, we must go with the exception handling.

Please verify. (Added status codes to IJavaThread, and JDI Model presentation 
handles the known codes).
